title: Flint miners of the Nullabor
creator_credit: S A Museum, Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies and Robert Edwards
brief_description: Koonalda Cave in the Nullabor had been worked as a flint quarry 20,000 years ago. Flint had been used by prehistoric man to fashion simple, functional implements. The first known ventures of Australians into the realm of art were discovered on the walls of the cave.
creator_credit_for_label: S A Museum, Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies and Robert Edwards
